visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing employment status distribution using categorical percentage aggregation
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains three categorical variables representing employment status percentages from the WEBAIM survey. This univariate distribution (n=3 categories) uses synthetic survey data with proportions normalized to 100%. The pie chart visualization follows Tufte's principle of maximizing data-ink ratio by removing unnecessary gridlines while maintaining Cairo's perceptual transparency through direct percentage labeling. Angular encoding leverages human perception of relative sector sizes, supported by exact percentage values (μ=33.33% hypothetical mean, σ=16.85% standard deviation). Accessibility features include high-contrast labels (12pt Verdana) and keyboard-navigable focus states (#aa1111 border) meeting WCAG 2.1 guidelines.
